headers.subject: [tosdr:2608] Flattr doesn't notify you if they share your information

html:
We may release personal information when we believe in good faith that release is necessary to comply with a law; to enforce or apply the Terms or other agreements and policies; or to protect the rights, property, or safety of Flattr, our employees, our users or others. This includes exchanging information with other companies and organisations for fraud protection and credit risk reduction.

http://flattr.com/privacy

Title: Flattr doesn't notify you if they share your information

Topic: personal-data

Summary: Although Flattr will only release your information to comply with the law, they make no mention of any user-notification process. This removes the opportunity for any user to explicitly opt out of this sharing.

Score: 80 (mediocre) 

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
